sentence.Network_en: I have a hunch that he didn't really want to go.
sentence.Network_cn: 我有这么一种感觉,他并不真正想去.

sentence.Network_en: Then Mr. Kamenar, acting on a hunch, ran a computer check at the Federal Election Commission.
sentence.Network_cn: 然后卡姆纳尔先生凭直觉在联邦选举委员会的计算机系统中进行了查询。

sentence.Network_en: I had a hunch that Susan and I would work well together.
sentence.Network_cn: 我有预感和苏珊共事会很融洽。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 正当理由高于怀疑或者是预感（hunch）；但是要轻于无合理怀疑确信的证据（proof）。   合理怀疑在程度上低于正当理由，但并不是 …

1. 渣坑hunch 直觉; 大片; 大块; 厚片hunch-back 脊柱后凸
听力口译单词表 - 豆丁网 ... clutch 抓住 • hunch 隆起 prospectus 简介 •.

list.abs: as soon as I arrived I knew the hunch was right .我一到就知道我们猜想得不错。

on a hunch ( call it nursing judgment ) , I checked the chart after the admitting clerk had finished registering the family . no address-they were homeless . the waiting room was warm .我有一个直觉（可以称之为护士的判断力)，在接待员为他们全家做了登记以后，我查看了登记表格。没有填写地址-原来他们是无家可归的人。候诊室很暖和
I had worked on this job for ten years and I have a hunch that we workers were getting pooper .我干这行已10年了。我总有一种预感：我们这些工人是越来越穷。
hot-rolled plain bar 热轧光圆钢筋hunched beam 加腋梁-
certain candidates hunch over , glance furtively around the room or wring their sweaty palms .某些求职者会伸直身体，茫然地瞟着房间周围，或是扭动出汗的手掌。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent.: of unknown origin. The original meaning was 'push, shove' (noun and verb), a sense retained now in Scots as a noun, and in US dialect as a verb. Sense 1 of the noun derives probably from a US sense of the verb 'nudge someone in order to draw attention to something'

entry.def: If you have a hunch about something, you are sure that it is correct or true, even though you do not have any proof.

example.ex: I had a hunch that Susan and I would work well together...
example.tran: 我有预感和苏珊共事会很融洽。

example.ex: Then Mr. Kamenar, acting on a hunch, ran a computer check at the Federal Election Commission.
example.tran: 然后卡姆纳尔先生凭直觉在联邦选举委员会的计算机系统中进行了查询。

entry.tran: （常指因寒冷、生病或愁苦而）耸肩弓身，蜷起身子
entry.def: If you hunch forward, you raise your shoulders, put your head down, and lean forwards, often because you are cold, ill, or unhappy.

example.ex: He got out his map of Yorkshire and hunched over it to read the small print.
example.tran: 他拿出约克郡地图，弓身趴在上面努力看清那些细小的字体。

entry.def: If you hunch your shoulders, you raise them and lean forwards slightly.

example.ex: Wes hunched his shoulders and leaned forward on the edge of the counter.
example.tran: 韦斯耸起双肩，身体前倾靠在柜台边上。

means.word_mean: 1. an impression that something might be the case;

sentences.sentence: "he had an intuition that something had gone wrong"

means.word_mean: 2. the act of bending yourself up together
